title: So, What Are Trader Joe's Hours for Thanksgiving Day?
text:
From House Beautiful

If browsing the aisles at Trader Joe’s is one of your favorite pastimes, you’re not alone. The brand's gained a cult following for stocking its shelves with the kinds of food and drinks you won't find anywhere else—and not just because they're all under the company's own label. With fall’s arrival just around the corner, the grocery store will be filling shelves with its signature pumpkin products, but if you plan on stopping by on Thursday, November 28, you’ll probably be out of luck. Trader Joe’s will most likely be closed on Thanksgiving Day.

Similar to Costco, Trader Joe’s is known for observing Thanksgiving Day along with New Year’s Day, and has modified hours for other holidays, like Easter, July 4th, Christmas Day, and New Year’s Eve. But we encourage you to stay tuned for Trader Joe's official announcement. At this point, it's all speculation, based on what they've done in the past, until we hear directly from the brand.

Will Trader Joe's be open on Black Friday?

After filling up on turkey and watching a few hours of football, you may have the option to go to Trader Joe’s: Most stores will likely be open on Black Friday from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sure, Trader Joe’s may not have Black Friday deals—at least, that hasn't been the case in the past—but it can still be your go-to stop to restock on everyone’s favorite stuffing and gravy, because who doesn’t love eating Thanksgiving food for the rest of the holiday weekend?

Follow House Beautiful on Instagram.

description: Start planning your Turkey Day NOW.
